N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 506.1 - Authorization for and purpose for procurement

State Regulations
(a) During the acute emergency period
immediately following attack each local director of civil defense is hereby
expressly authorized to purchase, rent or requisition (take) within his own
territory in the name of the State, for temporary or permanent use, the
emergency materials, supplies, equipment and facilities he finds necessary: (1)
to provide for the injured, homeless or
distressed persons found in or brought into his territory because of the
attack; (2)
to provide for the
effective maintenance and operation of the civil defense personnel under his
orders, or who may be placed under his orders because of the attack. (b) Such purchase, rental or
requisition (taking) by a local director shall normally be in amounts required
for not more than 48 hours after the attack unless the time be specifically
extended by the State director acting for the commission. Should the time
required to establish communication with the State director exceed 48 hours
after the attack, said local director is hereby authorized to purchase, rent or
requisition the added amounts necessary to cover the period beyond 48 hours
until such communication is established. Notes
